Question: What is the name of your Terraform Enterprise initiative?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this Terraform Enterprise project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What infrastructure automation challenges are you trying to solve?
Guidance: Common challenges: Inconsistent infrastructure provisioning, Lack of collaboration on infrastructure code, No policy enforcement or governance, Manual approval processes, Cloud cost overruns, Compliance and audit gaps
Notes: Primary business driver for Terraform Enterprise investment

Question: What is your current infrastructure as code workflow?
Guidance: Describe: Terraform usage (open source vs cloud), State management approach, Team collaboration methods, Approval processes

Question: What Infrastructure as Code tools are you currently using?
Guidance: Tools: Terraform Open Source, Terraform Cloud Free, CloudFormation, ARM Templates, Ansible, Custom scripts, None
Notes: Current IaC maturity and migration needs

Question: How many infrastructure resources do you manage with Terraform?
Notes: Infrastructure scale drives workspace and run capacity

Question: What are your primary goals for implementing Terraform Enterprise?
Guidance: Common goals: Centralize Terraform state management, Enable team collaboration on infrastructure code, Implement policy as code governance, Provide self-service infrastructure provisioning, Improve security and compliance posture, Reduce infrastructure deployment time, Support multi-cloud strategy

Question: How will you measure Terraform Enterprise success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: Infrastructure deployment time reduction, Policy compliance rate, Number of self-service workspace runs, Infrastructure drift reduction, Team productivity improvement

Question: What is your expected timeline for Terraform Enterprise implementation?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-3 months, 3-6 months, 6-12 months, 12+ months

Question: What is your approved budget for this Terraform Enterprise solution?
Guidance: Include: Terraform Enterprise licenses (per-seat or per-run), Infrastructure costs (hosting), Professional services, Training. Common ranges: $50K-250K, $250K-1M, $1M+

Question: What is your long-term vision for infrastructure automation?
Guidance: Consider expansion to: Additional teams and workloads, More cloud providers, Advanced automation (drift detection policy enforcement), Integration with CI/CD and ITSM

Question: How do you expect Terraform usage to grow over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide: Current workspace count, Current user count, Projected growth rate

Question: What is your current Terraform experience and usage level?
Guidance: Options: No Terraform experience, Basic Terraform OSS usage, Intermediate (modules workspaces), Advanced (remote backends providers), Terraform Cloud Free
Notes: Team skill level and migration complexity

Question: What Terraform version(s) are you currently using?
Guidance: Specify versions: 0.12.x, 0.13.x, 0.14.x, 0.15.x, 1.0+, 1.1+, 1.2+, Mixed versions

Question: How are you currently managing Terraform state?
Guidance: Options: Local state files, Remote backend (S3 Azure GCS), Terraform Cloud Free, Consul, No state management yet

Question: Which cloud providers do you use with Terraform?
Guidance: Providers: AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud, VMware, OpenStack, Kubernetes, Other

Question: What types of infrastructure do you provision with Terraform?
Guidance: Resource types: Compute (VMs containers), Networking (VPC subnets load balancers), Storage (block object database), Security (IAM firewalls), Kubernetes, Databases, Serverless, SaaS integrations

Question: How many Terraform workspaces do you expect to manage?
Guidance: Ranges: 1-25, 26-100, 101-500, 500+. Consider: environments x applications x teams

Question: What is your Terraform module strategy?
Guidance: Options: No modules (flat configs), In-house private modules, Public registry modules, Combination of public and private, Module versioning and testing

Question: What version control system do you use for Terraform code?
Guidance: Options: GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Azure DevOps, Other, None currently

Question: Where will you deploy Terraform Enterprise?
Guidance: Options: Kubernetes (EKS AKS GKE), Virtual machines (AWS Azure GCP on-prem), Docker containers, Cloud-managed (Terraform Cloud SaaS)

Question: What networking and connectivity requirements exist?
Guidance: Requirements: Private network access only, VPN connectivity, Internet access restrictions, Proxy requirements, Air-gapped environment

Question: What systems need to integrate with Terraform Enterprise?
Guidance: Integration targets: CI/CD (Jenkins GitLab CI GitHub Actions), Monitoring (Datadog Splunk), ITSM (ServiceNow Jira), Vault (secrets), Sentinel (policies), Cost management tools

Question: How many concurrent Terraform runs do you need to support?
Guidance: Ranges: 1-5, 6-15, 16-50, 50+. Consider: Peak usage, Team distribution, CI/CD automation

Question: How frequently will Terraform runs execute?
Guidance: Patterns: On-demand manual runs, Scheduled nightly/weekly, Triggered by VCS commits, Continuous (on every PR), Event-driven (webhooks)
Notes: Run patterns and queue management needs

Question: What are your infrastructure provisioning performance requirements?
Guidance: Specify: Maximum acceptable plan duration, Maximum acceptable apply duration, Workspace run queue tolerance

Question: Do you use custom or private Terraform providers?
Guidance: Options: Public providers only (AWS Azure GCP), Private providers (internal APIs), Custom-developed providers, Mix of public and private

Question: What is the security classification of your infrastructure code?
Guidance: Levels: Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted
Notes: Determines encryption and access control requirements

Question: What sensitive data is in Terraform configurations?
Guidance: Sensitive data: Cloud credentials, Database passwords, API keys, Application secrets, Certificate private keys, Customer data
Notes: Secrets management and Vault integration needs

Question: What compliance standards must Terraform Enterprise meet?
Guidance: Common standards: SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, FedRAMP, GDPR, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, CIS Benchmarks

Question: What encryption requirements apply?
Guidance: Requirements: State encryption at rest (AES-256), State encryption in transit (TLS 1.2+), Encrypted backups, Customer-managed keys (CMK)

Question: What authentication and authorization requirements apply?
Guidance: Options: SSO (SAML/OIDC), MFA required, RBAC with team-based permissions, Active Directory/LDAP, Service account management, Just-in-time access

Question: What audit and logging requirements do you have?
Guidance: Requirements: All Terraform runs logged, Plan/apply approval audit trail, State access logs, Policy evaluation logs, SIEM integration (Splunk Datadog)
Notes: Audit trail and compliance reporting needs

Question: How do you manage secrets for Terraform runs?
Guidance: Options: Environment variables, HashiCorp Vault integration, Cloud secrets managers (AWS Secrets Manager Azure Key Vault), Hardcoded (insecure), Not yet determined

Question: What network security controls are required?
Guidance: Controls: Private network deployment only, VPN access required, IP whitelisting, Network segmentation, TLS mutual authentication, Certificate management

Question: Do you require security scanning of Terraform code?
Guidance: Scanning types: Static analysis (tfsec checkov), Policy enforcement (Sentinel OPA), Compliance validation, Vulnerability scanning, Cost estimation

Question: What infrastructure policies need to be enforced?
Guidance: Policy types: Security policies (encryption required tagging standards), Cost policies (instance size limits region restrictions), Compliance policies (approved resources data residency), Naming conventions, Resource tagging

Question: What approval workflows are needed for infrastructure changes?
Guidance: Workflow types: Peer review required, Manager approval for production, Change advisory board review, Auto-approve for dev/test, Security team review for production

Question: What policy as code framework do you prefer?
Guidance: Options: Sentinel (Terraform native), OPA (Open Policy Agent), Custom policy scripts, Cloud-native policies (AWS Config Azure Policy), Multiple frameworks

Question: What cost governance features do you need?
Guidance: Features: Pre-run cost estimation, Budget alerts and limits, Resource tagging enforcement, Rightsizing recommendations, Unused resource detection, Multi-cloud cost comparison

Question: How should workspaces be organized and governed?
Guidance: Organization models: By team, By application, By environment (dev staging prod), By cloud provider, By business unit, Combination approach

Question: What role-based access control model do you need?
Guidance: Roles: Read-only viewers, Plan-only users, Apply-authorized operators, Workspace administrators, Organization owners, Custom granular roles

Question: What uptime requirements do you have for Terraform Enterprise?
Guidance: Common targets: 99% (Business hours), 99.5% (Extended hours), 99.9% (24x7 standard), 99.95% (Mission critical)

Question: What are your Recovery Time and Recovery Point Objectives?
Guidance: RTO: Maximum acceptable platform downtime, RPO: Maximum acceptable data/state loss, DR testing frequency

Question: What support coverage do you require?
Guidance: Options: Business hours (8x5), Extended (24x5), Full (24x7), Follow-the-sun support

Question: What monitoring and observability is required?
Guidance: Monitoring needs: Run status and duration, Queue depth and wait times, Apply success/failure rates, Resource provisioning metrics, Policy compliance tracking, Performance dashboards

Question: What backup and recovery strategy is needed?
Guidance: Requirements: State backup frequency (real-time continuous daily), State retention period, Cross-region backup, Point-in-time recovery, Workspace configuration backup

Question: Do you need infrastructure drift detection and remediation?
Guidance: Options: Scheduled drift detection scans, Alert on drift detection, Automated drift remediation, Manual drift correction workflows, Drift reporting and analytics

Question: What notifications and alerting do you need?
Guidance: Alerts: Run failures, Policy violations, State lock conflicts, Queue depth thresholds, Security events, Integration: Slack Teams PagerDuty email

Question: What migration support do you need?
Guidance: Migration scope: Terraform OSS state import, Terraform Cloud Free migration, CloudFormation/ARM conversion, Manual infrastructure discovery, Workspace recreation
Notes: Migration strategy and state import planning

Question: What self-service capabilities do you need for teams?
Guidance: Capabilities: Create own workspaces, Manage workspace variables, Trigger runs on-demand, Review and approve plans, Access run logs and state, Module discovery

Question: How is your infrastructure team organized?
Guidance: Team composition: Infrastructure/Platform engineers, DevOps engineers, Application developers, Cloud architects, Security engineers, Operations teams

Question: How many people will use Terraform Enterprise?
Guidance: Ranges: 1-10, 11-50, 51-200, 200+. Include: Operators (can apply), Developers (can plan), Viewers (read-only)

Question: What is your team's current Terraform skill level?
Guidance: Levels: Beginner (no Terraform experience), Intermediate (basic configs), Advanced (modules providers), Expert (custom providers complex automation)

Question: What training and enablement do you need?
Guidance: Training types: Terraform fundamentals, Terraform Enterprise administration, Module development, Sentinel policy writing, GitOps workflows, Best practices

Question: What knowledge transfer deliverables do you require?
Guidance: Deliverables: Architecture documentation, Runbooks and SOPs, Module development guide, Policy template library, Video tutorials, Best practices guide

Question: What ongoing support model do you prefer post-implementation?
Guidance: Options: Fully managed service, Co-managed (shared responsibility), Self-managed with advisory, Training and complete handoff
